content: I filed #25267 for clarifying the UI for editing a message that has already been scheduled, which we hadn't thought about in detail before. Any feedback is appreciated.

In connection with the proposal to remove the "in the middle of scheduling" state in #25267, Tim Abbott and I were thinking we could simplify the editing flow as well by unscheduling the message when you click the pencil to edit it. (We'd want to adjust the tooltip and probably some other text.) Ideally, we'd offer the previously scheduled time as one of the default options in the scheduling modal, to make it easy to recover.

How does that sound?

@Aman (amanagr) just making sure you see this.
A sample label would be "Unschedule and edit in compose box", though I'm sure we can do better than that.
Thanks! That would greatly help simplify things.
